v8:item.v8:content:
Obsolete patches were not deleted regularly when upgrading to a new version, so they were deleted the first time the administrator entered the application. Possible reasons: • The update was performed by non-recommended third-party tools. • a patch that does not suit this application version was manually installed, for example, using Designer.
Such actions can lead to various errors when the application is running and when updating it to a new version. It is recommended that you use regular tools for updating.
The application was updated to version %1 on %2 at %3 (update duration: %4).
Cannot update the application. See the error details in the <link EventLog>event log</>.
Pending additional data processing procedures. Access to this data is temporarily restricted.

Data processing can take a long time (from 1 minute to several hours, depending on the data size). Applications users might experience lags during the data processing. Therefore, it is recommended that you schedule it to the lowest user activity periods.
Pending additional data processing procedures. Access to this data is temporary restricted. Please wait till the processing is completed.
Additional data processing procedures required for update to version xx.yy.zz are in progress. Access to this data is temporary restricted.
Header update is not in progress
Additional procedures of data processing are not executed as the "Deferred update" scheduled job is disabled. <link Enable>Enable</>
No object has been processed for the last hour. Probably data processing went into an endless loop

<b>• </><b>User experience</>: Data processing takes longer, but server load and user experience degradation are minimal. <b>• </><b>Data processing</>: Data processing is faster, but server load is higher and user experience degradation is significant. Use this mode when the availability of processed data is critical.

<b>● </><b>User experience</>: Data processing takes longer, but server load and user experience degradation are minimal. <b>● </><b>Data processing</>: Data processing is faster, but server load is higher and user experience degradation is significant. Use this mode when the availability of processed data is critical. <b>● </><b><fontsize 8>Number</></><b> of threads</>: The number of concurrent update handlers. The default value is 8. Recommended values: <b> •</>For regular operations, use up to 50-75% of the server cluster's processor cores. <b> •</>For forced updates during periods of low activity, use as many cores as available in the server cluster.
Data processing can take a long time (from 1 minute to several hours, depending on the data size). Applications users might experience lags during the data processing.
Hint about the period with least user activity
It is recommended that you schedule the data processing to run during the period of minimum user activity.
Some additional data processing procedures have not been completed.
Go to the deferred handler list
Go to the list and issues
Technical details from the event log to provide to technical support.
To view the application update report, go to <b>Administration</> — <b>Support and service</>.
Report on progress of data area update
Open list of additional data processing procedures
Open list of additional data processing procedures.
